subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|自|t1=nose|心|t2=heart|ls=ic}} – to breath (life) through one’s nose. Note that this uses the older meaning of {{lang|zh|自}}, as “nose”, rather than “self”.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*m-sak||breath; life; to breathe}}. Cognate with {{cog|kac|sa'||to breathe}}, {{cog|my|အသက်}}.

{{etystub|zh}} <!-- Is "great-grandchild" actually from this etymon? -->

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# to [[breathe]]; to [[pant]]
# to [[sigh]]; to [[blow]]
# to [[stop]]; to [[subside]]; to [[cease]]
# to put a [[stop]] to; to [[stop]]
# to [[rest]]; to have a rest
# to [[grow]]; to [[develop]]
# to [[calm]] down; to [[appease]]
# [[breath]]; [[life]]
# one's [[own]] [[children]]
# [[interest]]; [[dividend]]s
# [[message]]; [[news]]
